title: Compiler panicked unexpectedly on Option::unwrap()

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust Propietary. I could spend some time on producing this if absolutely required. ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` Error does not happen in 1.59.0-nightly (7d6f94817 2022-01-04) or rust version 1.58.0-beta.2 (0e07bcb68 2021-12-04). ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', /rustc/f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c/compiler/rustc_hir/src/definitions.rs:452:14 ```
Backtrace

``` query stack during panic: #0 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ``` Strangely this worked after a cargo clean whilst I was trying to produce a minimal test case so I can no longer reproduce.
